info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 3:17PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHWESTERN ROOSEVELT AND NORTHEASTERN CHAVES COUNTIES THROUGH 345 PM MDT... At 317 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles south of Elida, or 29 miles southwest of Portales, moving northwest at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Elida and Kenna. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building.
